text: The 1967 Arizona Wildcats football team represented the University of Arizona in the Western Athletic Conference (WAC) during the 1967 NCAA University Division football season. In their first season under head coach Darrell Mudra, the Wildcats compiled a 3–6–1 record (1–4 against WAC opponents), finished in fourth place in the WAC, and were outscored by their opponents, 231 to 162. The team played its home games in Arizona Stadium in Tucson, Arizona. The team's statistical leaders included Mark Reed with 759 passing yards, David Barajas with 337 rushing yards, and Roger Brautigan with 247 receiving yards. ==References== Arizona Category:Arizona Wildcats football seasons Arizona Wildcats football team
title: 1967 Arizona Wildcats football team
